title.bibl: Lietuva, Sept. 10, 1915. New Lithuanian Club Organized

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Lietuva, Sept. 10, 1915. NEW LITHUANIAN CLUB ORGANIZED

body.p: A new Lithuanian theatrical club has been organized in the Bridgeport section of Chicago. The organization has been named the "Amusement Club". The purpose of this organization will be to develop and organize a Lithuanian theater. Plans are being made to lease the second-floor hall of the Milda Theater, 3140 South Halsted Street, and establish a daily vaudeville show. Later, if these shows are sufficiently supported and endorsed by the Lithuanian public, the Lithuania Theater, at 3214 South Halsted Street, will be opened and the daily Lithuanian vaudeville shows will be continued there.
